bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.4 Python version: Python 3.7.7 Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Sweeping parameters hangs up and does not throw any errors or traceback. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
In my Jupyter notebook <denchmark-code>def tune(): wandb.init(project=project)
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.33) model = Sequential() model.add(Dense(wandb.config.first_hidden_layer, kernel_initializer=wandb.config.kernels, input_dim=wandb.config.first_hidden_layer, activation=wandb.config.activation1)) .... opt = wandb.config.optimizer model.compile(loss=wandb.config.losses, optimizer=opt, metrics=['accuracy', 'categorical_accuracy', f1_m,precision_m, recall_m]) model.fit( X_train, y_train, epochs=wandb.config.epochs, verbose=0, validation_data=(X_test, y_test), batch_size=wandb.config.batch_size, callbacks=[WandbCallback(labels=labels)] ) y_probas = model.predict(X_test) wandb.log({'pr': wandb.plots.precision_recall(y_test, y_probas, labels=labels)}) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>sweep_config = { 'method': 'random', 'parameters': { 'activation1': {"values": ["relu"]}, 'last_activation': { "values": ['sigmoid', 'softmax']}, 'batch_size': {"values" : random.sample(range(1, 64), 3) + [100]}, 'epochs': {"values" : [1000, 1200, 1300, 1500]}, 'optimizer': {"values" : ['Nadam','Adam', 'sgd']}, 'losses': {"values" : ['categorical_crossentropy']}, 'kernels': {"values" : ['random_normal', 'random_uniform', "truncated_normal", "glorot_normal", "glorot_uniform"]}, } } sweep_id = wandb.sweep(sweep_config, project=project) wandb.agent(sweep_id, function=tune) </denchmark-code>
The sweep is then created the agent says it started running, however, it does not actually run and hangs up. No metrics are recorded on the web interface.

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajay340>@ajay340</denchmark-link> This is likely due to your notebook attaching to the gpu before you run the sweep. PyTorch / Tensorflow don't play nice with GPU's and multiprocessing. If you move all of your imports into your train function this will work. See: <denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/sweeps/python-api#wandb-agent>https://docs.wandb.com/sweeps/python-api#wandb-agent</denchmark-link>
